title: Factor into Primes
text: Factor each coefficient into primes. A prime number is a counting number greater than $$1$$, whose only factors are $$1$$ and itself. The first few prime numbers are: $$2$$, $$3$$, $$5$$, $$7$$, $$11$$, $$13$$, etc.
speech: Factor each coefficient into primes. A prime number is a counting number greater than  1 , whose only factors are  1  and itself. The first few prime numbers are:  2 ,  3 ,  5 ,  7 ,  11 ,  13 , etc.
pacedSpeech: Factor each coefficient into primes. A prime number is a counting number greater than   1
and itself. The first few prime numbers are:   2

title: Factor First Number
speech: 72 is equal to, 8 times 9 \n 72, is equal to 4 times 2 3 times 3 \n 72 is equal to, 2 times 2 times 2 3 times 3

title: Factor Second Number
speech: 162 is equal to, 2 times 81, \n 40 is equal to, 2 times 9 times 9, \n 40 is equal to 2 times 3 times 3 times 3 times 3

title: Identify Common Factors in each Column
text: $$72=2\times2\times2 3\times3$$\n$$40=2\times3\times3\times3\times3$$\n$$2$$, $$3$$, and $$3$$ are shared by both numbers.
speech: 72 is equal to 2 times 2 times 2 3 times 3 \n 40 is equal to 2 times 3 times 3 times 3 times 3 \n 2 ,  3 , and  3  are shared by both numbers.
pacedSpeech: 72 is equal to 2 times 2 times 2 3 times 3
40 is equal to 2 times 3 times 3 times 3 times 3

title: Multiply Common Factors
text: Bring down the $$2$$, $$3$$, and $$3$$, and then multiply.\n$$GCF=2\times3\times3$$
